content.description: The crux of this route is out in the middle of the traverse with the biggest fall potential.
content.protection: As the name implies, this climb is dangerous.  Don't do it if you think you might fall as traversing out on this lip has you looking at a pretty sizable digger.
content.location: Start on the far left side of the boulder and traverse the obvious ledge system that runs around the entire boulder.

content.description: This route is Almost Awesome, and its almost awesome.  Move out the super steep face on crimps, sidepulls, and underclings, finishing out a big move to the huge ledge that is the start of the Danger Traverse.  Continue out easy climbing up from there, or go right and do the Danger Traverse for the linkup problem called Awesome Dangerverse (V2+).
content.location: This starts in the back left side of the cave.  Look for a sortof crappy face hold on the left side of the cave, and climb out on the left side of the roof.

content.description:
The approach to this climb is short but heinous.  Be very mindful not to knock rocks loose as you stumble up the loose slope as we don't want stuff ending up on the road where people might hit it. 

  If anything will get the JBR Bouldering shut down it will be someone knocking a rock loose and having it go out onto the road.  Be very very careful if you do plan to visit this boulder!!!
